title: 3  MERFISH
text:
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)
library(ggnewscale)
library(SpatialData)
library(SpatialData.data)
library(SpatialData.plot)
##  Warning: replacing previous import 'SpatialData::layer' by 'ggplot2::layer'
##  when loading 'SpatialData.plot'
library(SingleCellExperiment)
##  Warning: package 'SingleCellExperiment' was built under R version 4.4.2
##  Warning: package 'IRanges' was built under R version 4.4.2
##  Warning: package 'GenomeInfoDb' was built under R version 4.4.2


dir.create(td <- tempfile())
zs <- unzip_spd_demo(
    zipname="merfish", 
    source="biocOSN",
    destination=td)
##  returning path to cached zip
(sd <- readSpatialData(zs))
##  class: SpatialData
##  - images(1):
##    - rasterized (1,522,575)
##  - labels(0):
##  - points(1):
##    - single_molecule (3714642)
##  - shapes(2):
##    - anatomical (6,polygon)
##    - cells (2389,circle)
##  - tables(1):
##    - table (268,2389)
##  coordinate systems:
##  - global(4): rasterized anatomical cells single_molecule


p <- point(sd, "single_molecule")
p <- p[sample(length(p), 2e3)]
point(sd, "molecules") <- p
plotSpatialData() +
    plotImage(sd) +
    new_scale_color() +
    plotShape(sd, "anatomical") +
    new_scale_color() +
    plotPoint(sd, "molecules", c="cell_type", s=0.1)
##  Scale for y is already present.
##  Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.
##  Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
##  (`geom_point()`).

title: 2  Datasets
text:
Datasets from spatialdata.scverse.org have been deposited in Bioconductor’s OSN bucket, and can be loaded into R using SpatialData.data, with support for caching using BiocFileCache.

library(SpatialData)
library(SpatialData.data)

We can get a list of available datasets via:

available_spd_zarr_zips()
##  [1] "mcmicro_io.zip"                         
##  [2] "merfish.zarr.zip"                       
##  [3] "mibitof.zip"                            
##  [4] "steinbock_io.zip"                       
##  [5] "visium_associated_xenium_io_aligned.zip"
##  [6] "visium_hd_3.0.0_io.zip"                 
##  [7] "xenium_rep1_io_aligned.zip"             
##  [8] "xenium_rep2_io_aligned.zip"

Any of the above can be retrieved using unzip_spd_demo(), and read into a R using readSpatialData(); e.g.:

dir.create(td <- tempfile())
zs <- unzip_spd_demo(
    zipname="mibitof.zip", 
    source="biocOSN",
    destination=td)
(sd <- readSpatialData(zs))
##  class: SpatialData
##  - images(3):
##    - point16_image (3,1024,1024)
##    - point23_image (3,1024,1024)
##    - point8_image (3,1024,1024)
##  - labels(3):
##    - point16_labels (1024,1024)
##    - point23_labels (1024,1024)
##    - point8_labels (1024,1024)
##  - points(0):
##  - shapes(0):
##  - tables(1):
##    - table (36,3309)
##  coordinate systems:
##  - point16(2): point16_image point16_labels
##  - point23(2): point23_image point23_labels
##  - point8(2): point8_image point8_labels
